skills. 
Familiar with the food & beverage, chemical and pharmaceutical industries amongst others.

Name: Samuel Helliwell 
Professional qualifications: Chemical Engineering BEng (Hons) (Manchester) (2011) 
 
Profile 
Self-motivated chemical engineer with a broad experience and skills base across process and project 
engineering developed through employment in process engineering design houses. Creative 
problem solver delivering high levels of attention to detail. Clear verbal and written communication 
skills. 
Familiar with the food & beverage, chemical and pharmaceutical industries amongst others. 
 
Career Summary 
Date Employer  Position 
June 2015 – Present NIRAS (VM Engineering), Bury  Process/Project Engineer  
July 2011 – April 2015  Manrochem, Huddersfield  Process Engineer  
 
Experience 
June 2015 to Present       Process/Project Engineer 
NIRAS (VM Engineering), Bury, Greater Manchester 
Responsible for the engineering delivery and management of projects executed by NIRAS, generally 
in the food & beverage industry. 
As a Process/Project Engineer my main duties/responsibilities have included: 
 Flow sheet and P&ID development 
 Hygienic design/Aseptic design – CIP/SIP 
 Process engineering calculations 
 Equipment design, specification and bid 
analysis 
 Conceptual design development 
 Detailed plant design 
 Front End Engineering Design (FEED) 
studies  Project Budget/Quote preparation 
 Design Risk Assessments, HazOp  
 Commissioning  
 Site surveying and technical reporting  
 Mentoring junior engineers  
 Sub-contractor liaison  
 Site supervision  
Major Projects undertaken at NIRAS (VM Engineering): 
Date Client Project Value 
Jan 2020 - Present Muller, Market Drayton  Raw Cream Expansion  £400k 
Oct 2020 - Present Muller, Market Drayton  Yogurt Cooler Upgrade  £150k 
Sep 2019 – Dec 2019  FreislandCampina, 
Maasland, Netherlands New Quark Plant URS Generation  £40M 
Jan 2019 - Oct 2019 Muller, Hanworth  Bulk Chemical Upgrade FEED Study  £500k 
Sep 2018 - Augt 2019  Arla Foods, North 
Yorkshire White Water Recovery FEED Study  £400k 
Dec 2018 - May 2019  Muller, Hanworth  New CIP Sets FEED Study  £1.3M

Oct 2017 - Aug 2018  Muller, Telford  New Filling Machine Integration  £1M 
May 2017 - Sep 2018 Muller, Telford  Yogurt Incubation and Storage Expansion  £1.5M 
Apr 2016 - May 2018  Muller, Telford  New Bulk Chemical and CIP System, ‘Raw’/‘Finished’ CIP 
Segregation £1.2M 
Oct 2016 - May 2017  Muller, Telford  Product Aeration Modification  £150k 
Mar 2016 - Sep 2016 Muller, Market Drayton  Product Aeration Modification  £150k

Mar 2016 - Jun 2016 Confidential  Bioreactor FEED Study  £150k 
Jun 2015 - Mar 2016  Muller, Market Drayton  New Filling Machine Integration  £300k 
(Typically turnkey projects ranging from £100k - £2M)

Manrochem, Huddersfield, West Yorkshire 
Responsible for the process engineering delivery of work awarded to the company across the 
chemical, pharmaceutical, food and beverage industries amongst others. 
Duties/responsibilities differing from present have included: 
• Mass and energy balances 
• Hazardous area classification studies

Sites)
